New Records: Kylian Mbappé scored his first-ever goal at a European Championship.
Key Match Events: Kylian Mbappé scored a penalty to put France ahead.
Robert Lewandowski equalized from a penalty after a retake.
Ousmane Dembélé was brought down in the Poland area leading to France's penalty.
Karol Swiderski was tripped by Dayot Upamecano leading to Poland's penalty.
Mike Maignan saved Lewandowski's first penalty attempt but was off his line, leading to a retake.
Pre-Game Insights: Antoine Griezmann was left out of the starting XI, with Bradley Barcola getting his first start for France.
Robert Lewandowski returned to the stadium where he made his name with Borussia Dortmund.
Post-Match Reflections: France will now head to Duesseldorf for a last-16 tie against the runners-up in Group E.
France is now on the same side of the draw as Portugal, Spain, and Germany.
Poland had already been eliminated before this game but managed to rescue some pride with the draw.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Théo Hernandez tested Lukasz Skorupski, who started in goal instead of Wojciech Szczesny.
Mbappé wore a mask to protect his injured nose and removed it during a drinks break.
The match was played in sweltering conditions.
